intro: Lasiosiphon burchellii, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from deep purple to bright blue. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other climbing vines and ornamental plants. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and twining. Lasiosiphon burchellii typically grows in open woodland and grassland areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
